metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14528 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
The TIFFSetProfiles function in coders/tiff.c in ImageMagick 7.0.6 has incorrect expectations about whether LibTIFF TIFFGetField return values imply that data validation has occurred, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (use-after-free after an invalid call to TIFFSetField, and application crash) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14528` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
imagemagick-6-common - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
imagemagick-6.q16hdri - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
imagemagick-common - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libimage-magick-q16hdri-perl - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagick++-6.q16-8 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagick++-6.q16hdri-8 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickcore-6.q16-6 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickcore-6.q16-6-extra - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickcore-6.q16hdri-6-extra - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickwand-6.q16-6 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
libmagickwand-6.q16hdri-6 - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
perlmagick - 8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> code not present in jessie sespiros> (xenial) cannot reproduce in 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm1

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.10.8+dfsg-1ubuntu2').
